thread.title: The 12 Best and Worst Celebrity Tattoos
thread.title_full: The 12 Best and Worst Celebrity Tattoos

author: cflammia
title: The 12 Best and Worst Celebrity Tattoos
text:
A photo posted by Zayn Malik (@zayn) on Sep 5, 2015 at 7:58pm PDT 
Singer Zayn Malik is one of the few men on earth who can pull of this mandala and henna-style piece. He also knows a thing or two about rocking a puffy coat . 
6. Kevin Durant A photo posted by ThompsonScribe (@thompsonscribe) on Jul 21, 2016 at 12:24pm PDT 
We’d give our left leg to bring Tupac back, but basketball star Kevin Durant raised us one more with this large memorial piece of the rapper. 
5. Harry Styles A photo posted by @harrystyles on Mar 9, 2013 at 8:15am PST 
Pop star Harry Styles’ butterfly tat suits him—and guarantees he can never evolve to a form without six-pack abs. 
4. David Beckham A photo posted by David Beckham (@davidbeckham) on Mar 30, 2016 at 10:28am PDT 
David and Victoria Beckham’s tattoos are cool enough to have their own website . Our favorite double whammy: a pin-up illustration of Victoria tattooed on David. 
3. The Rock A photo posted by therock (@therock) on Apr 22, 2016 at 8:36am PDT 
Actor and former pro-wrestler Dwayne Johnson traveled to Hawaii to tattoo his family history on him in Samoan tradition—made even more impressive looking by his hulking shoulders. 
2. Lenny Kravitz A photo posted by Lenny Kravitz (@lennykravitz) on Dec 31, 2014 at 3:53pm PST 
There’s getting “Mom” in a heart tattooed on you, and there’s getting a gorgeous portrait of actual mom on your forearm. Singer-songwriter Lenny Kravitz did the latter. 
1. Conor McGregor A photo posted by Conor McGregor Official (@thenotoriousmma) on Nov 3, 2016 at 7:00am PDT 
We will overlook the Irish MMA fighter having his own name inked on his body (did he think he was going to forget?) because who else could pull off a giant ape AND tiger head chest tattoo? We feel the sudden urge to hit the bench press.
